page.title: 12SEA ANGLING FROM ST.AGNES
page.content: THE CLIFFS AND SHORELINE BETWEEN ST.AGNES AND PERRANPORTH ARE POPULAR HAUNTS FOR SEA ANGLERS.THERE ARE NUMEROUS ROCKY LEDGES WHERE THE ANGLERS CAN CLAMBER DOWN WHICH ENABLE THEM TO CAST INTO RELATIVELY DEEP WATER.GOOD CATCHES OF MACKEREL AND POLLOCK CAN BE TAKEN AND THE SURF BEACHES GIVE GOOD SPORT FISHING FOR BASS.{TAKE CARE!}THE ATLANTIC SWELL CAN PRODUCE OCCASIONAL VERY LARGE WAVES WHICH CAN WASH OVER THE ROCKS AND SWEEP THE UNSUSPECTING ANGLER INTO THE SEA. THE FAVOURITE FISHING AREA FOR LOCAL ANGLERS IS CLIGGA HEAD.
